a.g: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أما الآيات: فقوله تعالى "فويل للمصلين الذين هم عن صلاتهم ساهون الذين هم يراءون" وقوله عز وجل "والذين يمكرون السيئات لهم عذاب شديد ومكر أولئك هو يبور" قال مجاهد هم أهل الرياء. وقال تعالى "إنما نعطمكم لوجه الله لا نريد منكم جزاء ولا شكورا" فمدح المخلصين ينفي كل إرادة سوى وجه الله، والرياء ضده وقال تعالى "فمن كان يرجو لقاء ربه فليعمل صالحاً ولا يشرك بعبادة ربه أحدا" نزل بعد ذلك فيمن يطلب الأجر والحمد بعباداته وأعماله.
Indeed, as for the verses: His Exalted statement: "So woe to those who pray, those who are heedless [sāhūn] of their prayer, those who make a show [yurā'ūn]" (107:4-6). And His Mighty and Majestic statement: "And those who plot evil deeds—for them is a severe punishment, and the plotting of those—it will perish" (35:10). Mujahid said: They are the people of ostentation [riyā']. And He, Exalted is He, said: "We feed you only for the countenance [li-wajhi] of God. We desire no reward from you, nor thanks" (76:9). Thus, He praised the sincere [mukhliṣīn] by negating every desire [irādah] other than the countenance [wajh] of God, and ostentation [riyā'] is its opposite. And He, Exalted is He, said: "So whoever hopes for the meeting [liqā'] with his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate [yushrik] in the worship of his Lord anyone" (18:110). This was revealed thereafter concerning one who seeks reward and praise for his acts of worship and his deeds.

a.g: [But] who are heedless of their prayer -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وسئل أبو العالية عن قوله تعالى: ﴿ الذين هم عن صلاتهم ساهون ﴾ قال هو الذي يسهو في صلاته فلا يدري على كم ينصرف أعلى شفع أم على وتر. وقال الحسن: هو الذي يسهو عن وقت الصلاة حتى تخرج. وقال بعضهم: هو الذي إن صلاها في أول الوقت لم يفرح وإن أخرها عن الوقت لم يحزن فلا يرى تعجيلها خيرا ولا تأخيرا إثما.
Indeed, Abu Al-'Aliyah was asked about His saying, the Most High: "Those who are heedless [sahun] of their prayer [salat]." He said: It is he who is heedless [yas-haw] in his prayer [salat], so he does not know upon what he concludes—whether upon an even [shaf'] or an odd [watr]. And Al-Hasan said: It is he who is heedless [yas-haw] of the time of the prayer [salat] until it passes. And some of them said: It is he who, if he prays it at the beginning of its time, does not rejoice, and if he delays it beyond its time, does not grieve, so he does not see hastening it as a good [khayr] nor delaying it as a sin [ithm].

a.g: Those who make show [of their deeds]
